Key Match Events: Mohammad Amir took two wickets in Pakistan's win over New Zealand in the second T20I on April 20, 2024.
Pakistan's big win in the second T20 International against New Zealand on April 20, 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Amir expressed his comfort and confidence on his comeback to the Pakistan national team, crediting senior players like Babar Azam and Shaheen Shah Afridi for their support.
Amir mentioned that the team should have no excuse for performing badly in the upcoming World Cup given their talent and experience.
Amir expressed his happiness and readiness to play any role for Pakistan after his long absence from international cricket.
Others: Mohammad Amir retired from international cricket in late 2020 but made a comeback on the insistence of the current board set-up and management.
Amir is the only player in the Pakistan squad in this series to have won two ICC titles as a player, including the World T20 Cup final in 2009 and the 2017 Champions Trophy.
